授業目的: International trade is an important foundation of economic development for any country. Therefore, economic integration has been formed and deepened in the world. To understand the present and future economies, it is necessary to understand why economic integration has developed, how it has deepened, and what challenges it poses. This course aims to provide students with analytical frameworks to understand various trade issues occurring in the real international economy. Based on basic trade theory, students will develop an understanding of various trade-related issues and the ability to apply it to policy discussions.
到達目標: The learning objectives of this course are the following three issues: 1) to gain the basic knowledge of international trade theory; 2) to acquire the knowledge of the latest academic research on major topics related to international trade; 3) to deepen the understanding of the background and effects of current trade topics such as the deepening of regional economic integration, global value chains and digital service trade. Students are expected to be able to apply the knowledge acquired in this course to constructive policy discussions on the real globalized economy.
授業の概要・背景: This course consists of five sections. 1) Introduction; 2) basic trade theory; 3) trade policy; 4) trade and economic development; and 5) current trade topics. Each session will include lectures on theory, empirical issues, and analytical tools and data.  In addition, students learn how to apply theory and empirical research to international trade policies through discussions and presentations in group works.
